title: parameterPane setting not captured for wide-layout nodes

metadata.affected_nodes: MySQL, Postgres, If V2, Filter V2, QuestDB, Snowflake

description.problem: `node_info` never includes the optional `parameterPane` property, even when nodes request a wide parameter pane.
description.impact: Medium – losing this flag breaks UI layout hints and causes wide-schema nodes (SQL, filters) to render in the cramped default pane for documentation and tooling.
description.root_cause: The metadata extraction step reads a fixed whitelist of description keys and ignores `parameterPane`. Versioned nodes spread a base description that contains `parameterPane: 'wide'`, but the extractor discards it.
description.fix_approach: 1. Add `parameterPane` to the metadata fields copied in `n8n_node_extractor.py`. 2. Preserve both string and boolean values. 3. Re-extract MySQL and If nodes to confirm the field appears. 4. Run `python3 validate_extraction.py` and spot-check other wide-pane nodes (Postgres, QuestDB) for the new metadata.
